learning_outcomes.description: Evaluate and analyse the theory behind different biomedical techniques.
Develop skills in qualitative and quantitative data analysis and presentation.
Evaluate and incorporate biostatistics into experimental design and data analysis.
Recognise and apply good laboratory practices consistent with high standards of research integrity.
Work and learn collaboratively, leveraging the diverse abilities, backgrounds, and perspectives within the group.

assessments.due_date:
4/08/2025

Quiz 1 will be done in-person at the start of Week 2, on Monday August 4th at the beginning of class (9am).
assessments.task_description:
Quiz 1 will cover concepts and material presented in week 1 of the course. Please see Blackboard for more details on the quiz format.

Have your UQ student ID card available at the quiz.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: We recommend that you do not use the Blackboard Phone App nor a wireless network connection when completing this Blackboard assessment. Both are unstable and could affect your ability to complete your Blackboard assessment, by for example:
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.due_date:
7/08/2025 - 11/08/2025

Online quiz will open at the end of class on Thursday and be available to complete online until the following Monday afternoon at 3:00pm. While there is a multi-day window to complete the quiz, once you begin the quiz it must be completed within the allocated time. Please see the BlackBoard site for further details.
assessments.task_description:
Online quiz will cover concepts and material presented in week 1 of the course. Please see Blackboard for more details on the quiz format.

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.
assessments.submission_guidelines: We recommend that you do not use the Blackboard Phone App nor a wireless network connection when completing this Blackboard assessment. Both are unstable and could affect your ability to complete your Blackboard assessment, by for example:
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Week 3 Module Assignment will consist of creating a publication quality figure using data sets given to each student by the module coordinator. Details of the assessment item, along with a marking rubric, will be available on the Blackboard site and accessible prior to the assignment.

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct. To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You must submit your Assessment task, with the electronic coversheet available on the School's website (under Undergraduate - Assessment), to Turnitin by the submission deadline. You may submit drafts to Turnitin up to the due date, but you will only be able to submit once on or after the due date. You should also keep an electronic copy of every piece of assessment you submit.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Week 5 module assignment will consist of a written proposal. Students will work in groups to write a proposal. The details of the assignment will be made available on Blackboard prior to Week 5.

assessments.due_date:
23/10/2025

Presentations will occur across two sessions on Thursday - during our normally scheduled workshop times.
assessments.task_description:
Students will prepare a presentation where they will overview a chosen research technique and place it in context using a seminal research paper from their field. The presentation will be 10 minutes in length, including questions from assessors. Details of the assignment, including a marking rubric, will be made available on Blackboard.

Have your UQ student ID card available at the oral presentation.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
Week 1

Week one includes an initial course introduction and cohort building workshop on Monday morning, followed by workshops and lectures around the topics of the scientific method and hypothesis testing on Thursday.

Learning outcomes: L01, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Week 1 Week one includes an initial course introduction and cohort building workshop on Monday morning, followed by workshops and lectures around the topics of the scientific method and hypothesis testing on Thursday.

learning_activities.topic:
Week 2

Week 2 consists of workshops and lectures on experimental design, biostatistics, and research ethics. These workshops run Monday morning and all day Thursday.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Week 2 Week 2 consists of workshops and lectures on experimental design, biostatistics, and research ethics. These workshops run Monday morning and all day Thursday.

learning_activities.topic:
Week 3

In week 3 students will attend one of two available modules on Microscopy or Flow Cytometry. Workshops focused on these technologies run Monday mornings and all day Thursday.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Week 3 In week 3 students will attend one of two available modules on Microscopy or Flow Cytometry. Workshops focused on these technologies run Monday mornings and all day Thursday.

learning_activities.topic:
Week 4

In week 4 students will attend one of two available modules on Microscopy or Flow Cytometry. Workshops focused on these technologies run Monday mornings and all day Thursday.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Week 4 In week 4 students will attend one of two available modules on Microscopy or Flow Cytometry. Workshops focused on these technologies run Monday mornings and all day Thursday.

learning_activities.topic:
Week 5

In week 5 all students will attend the same workshops. Week 5 workshops will focus on a small written project proposal which is to be completed for submission the following week. Details of the assignment will be made available on Blackboard.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_description: Week 5 In week 5 all students will attend the same workshops. Week 5 workshops will focus on a small written project proposal which is to be completed for submission the following week. Details of the assignment will be made available on Blackboard.

learning_activities.topic:
Week 12

In week 12 students will present their end of semester presentations to a general audience consisting of course lecturers and peers.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Week 12 In week 12 students will present their end of semester presentations to a general audience consisting of course lecturers and peers.
